paragraphs.text:
%md
# Welcome to Principles of Big data Management - Project
## Submitted by : Ruthvic Punyamurtula
### *COMP-SCI 5540 0001 - Spring 2018, University of Missouri - Kansas City*
#### Aim : 
* Collect tweets using twitter streaming API
* Extract URLs and Hastags fromt the tweets
* Run word count on the urls and hastags
* Run queries and analyse the collected tweets
* Visualize the data using graphs and charts

#### Tool : Apache Zeppelin

#### Installation Tutorial : http://zeppelin.apache.org/docs/0.7.3/install/install.html
#### This is a live demo

msg.data:
Welcome to Principles of Big data Management - Project

Submitted by : Ruthvic Punyamurtula

COMP-SCI 5540 0001 - Spring 2018, University of Missouri - Kansas City

Aim :

  • Collect tweets using twitter streaming API
  • Extract URLs and Hastags fromt the tweets
  • Run word count on the urls and hastags
  • Run queries and analyse the collected tweets
  • Visualize the data using graphs and charts

Tool : Apache Zeppelin

Installation Tutorial : http://zeppelin.apache.org/docs/0.7.3/install/install.html

This is a live demo

paragraphs.title: Loading the tweets file into Spark
paragraphs.text:
val sqlContext = new org.apache.spark.sql.SQLContext(sc)

    val textFile = sqlContext.read.json("C:\\Users\\ruthv\\Desktop\\PB\\Project\\PB_Phase1\\tweets.txt")
     //textFile.printSchema()

    textFile.registerTempTable("twit")

msg.data:
warning: there was one deprecation warning; re-run with -deprecation for details
sqlContext: org.apache.spark.sql.SQLContext = org.apache.spark.sql.SQLContext@452c7113
textFile: org.apache.spark.sql.DataFrame = [contributors: string, coordinates: struct<coordinates: array<double>, type: string> ... 35 more fields]

paragraphs.text:
%md
#### Now as the data frame is created using scala and spark, we can run the sql queries on this to analyse the tweets.
#### In the below sections, we will find the sql queries along with different charts to visualize the data

msg.data:
Now as the data frame is created using scala and spark, we can run the sql queries on this to analyse the tweets.

In the below sections, we will find the sql queries along with different charts to visualize the data

paragraphs.title: Tweets based on time zone
paragraphs.text:
%sql
select  user.time_zone,count(*)  from twit where user.time_zone is
not  null group by user.time_zone order by count(1) desc limit 10

msg.data:
time_zone	count(1)
Pacific Time (US & Canada)	10484
Eastern Time (US & Canada)	6197
Central Time (US & Canada)	3895
London	1535
Atlantic Time (Canada)	1176
Quito	1086
Brasilia	946
Arizona	800
Mountain Time (US & Canada)	732
Hawaii	507

paragraphs.title: Tweets count based on the input language
paragraphs.text:
%sql
select user.lang,count(*)  from twit where user.lang is not null  group by user.lang order by 
count(1) desc limit 10

msg.data:
lang	count(1)
en	54384
es	3725
pt	2596
th	1279
ja	1271
fr	825
en-gb	770
de	482
id	425
ko	353

paragraphs.title: Users created as per year
paragraphs.text:
%sql
select substring(user.created_at,27,4) as year,count(*)  from twit where user.created_at is not null
group by substring(user.created_at,27,4) order by count(1) desc

paragraphs.title: Loading hashtags into spark
paragraphs.text:
val hashtagsarray = spark.sql("select entities.hashtags from twit where entities.hashtags is not null")

    val hashtags = hashtagsarray.select(org.apache.spark.sql.functions.explode(hashtagsarray.col("hashtags")))
    val hashtagtext =hashtags.select("col.text")

    hashtagtext.createOrReplaceTempView("hashtags")

msg.data:
hashtagsarray: org.apache.spark.sql.DataFrame = [hashtags: array<struct<indices:array<bigint>,text:string>>]
hashtags: org.apache.spark.sql.DataFrame = [col: struct<indices: array<bigint>, text: string>]
hashtagtext: org.apache.spark.sql.DataFrame = [text: string]

paragraphs.title: Displaying the top 10 trending hashtags
paragraphs.text:
%sql
select text,count(*) from hashtags group by text order by count(1) desc limit 10

msg.data:
text	count(1)
InfinityWar	1839
Avengers	600
Syria	356
Programming	326
Elementary	323
Robotics	317
School	269
BigData	228
AvengersInfinityWar	228
AI	206

paragraphs.text:
%sql
select text,count(*) from hashtags  where text like '%ipl' or text like '%rcb%' 
or text like '%csk' group by text order by count(1)
paragraphs.title: IPL related queries

paragraphs.text:
%sql
select user.name,user.followers_count  from twit order by user.followers_count desc LIMIT 10
paragraphs.title: Top Followers

paragraphs.text:
%sql
select user.id,user.name,count(*) from twit where (user.id is not null and user.name is not null) group by user.id,user.name order by count(1) desc limit 10
paragraphs.title: Users who tweeted more

paragraphs.text:
val freqTweetUsers = sqlContext.sql("select user.id,user.name,count(*) from twit group by user.id,user.name order by count(1) desc limit 10")
freqTweetUsers.createOrReplaceTempView("moretweetusers")
 
val uniqueusers=spark.sql("select distinct user.id,user.verified from twit")
uniqueusers.createOrReplaceTempView("unique")
paragraphs.title: Data frame for users with more tweets and valid users

msg.data:
freqTweetUsers: org.apache.spark.sql.DataFrame = [id: bigint, name: string ... 1 more field]
uniqueusers: org.apache.spark.sql.DataFrame = [id: bigint, verified: boolean]

paragraphs.text:
%sql
select user.name,max(user.statuses_count) from twit where user.id in (select id from moretweetusers) group by user.name
paragraphs.title: Max Status Count

msg.data:
name	max(user.statuses_count AS `statuses_count`)

Mr. D R P	47263
業界ニュース(電機.精密機器)	156995

AIBigDataCloudIoTBot	3353527

paragraphs.text:
%sql
SELECT SUBSTR(created_at, 0, 10) tweet_date, COUNT(1) tweet_count FROM twit GROUP  BY SUBSTR(created_at, 0, 10) ORDER  BY COUNT(1) DESC LIMIT  10
paragraphs.title: Days and date with most tweets

msg.data:
tweet_date	tweet_count
Wed Apr 25	36896
Mon Apr 23	30210
null	774
Tue Apr 24	417

paragraphs.text:
%sql
select verified,count(*) from unique group by verified
paragraphs.title: Verified vs Unverified users

paragraphs.text:
%sql
SELECT count(*) as total_tweets FROM twit
paragraphs.title: Total tweets in the collected dataset

paragraphs.text:
%sql
SELECT count(DISTINCT user.id) as total_users FROM twit
paragraphs.title: Total Users

paragraphs.text:
%sql
SELECT count(retweeted_status.id) as total_retweets FROM twit
paragraphs.title: Total Retweets
